To anyone with SKSE saying update Skyrim; go into their "archived builds" and use an earlier version.

The current skse is for this game, if you didn't update skse or didn't install this game correctly, then that would likely be the cause. 1.6.13 skse is working for me.
Reloaded game updates are not incremental. This patch updates any game version from 1.0-1.9.

@russianhornybear, if your game is no longer working, then readd the steam_api.dll file and make sure to allow it in your antivirus program. It just happens to be a false positive. If you are paranoid and still untrust it, many people use the previous steam_api.dll from patch 11.
Basically the latest steam_api.dll tries to store stats and achievements for the game. So it is larger and there is a new ini file included. Yet once the false positive is flagged, in peoples minds, it is no longer trust worthy.
Getting compressed files makes a lot more sense, especially if they are as they were when released from reloaded.

Breton12, please stop posting bad advice when it is your fault for not even being able to follow directions in the NFO file. All you did was install the update with out placing the crack files. Now you are here complaining because you couldn't follow instructions. You could of used a bit of logic to solve this problem. When you noticed inside the rar archive it contained an update folder and crack folder, did it not occur to you, that the crack may be important part of this update?

This torrent is is the better choice of torrents. Simply because it is compressed, that is the most obvious, it's smaller and wastes less time and bandwidth for you and others to download. Secondly, it is unedited files directly from reloaded, the group who releases these updates. This also includes the original files as well as the cracked files. I know this seems meaningless, but maybe you found you could do something differently with the crack or maybe a specific bug you thought you could fix in the crack? Maybe you just wanted to test your skills at cracking it yourself. Either way, totenkruez uploaded a proper torrent and I appreciate it.

@wtb300: "rld-tesvsu13" stands for...
rld - Reloaded (the guy who cracked it)
t - The
e - Elder
s - Scrolls
v - 5
s - Skyrim
u13 - Update 13

Just a simple insight to the acronym, though, it does almost carry a sketchy air to the file name.
